title: Expose mixin method on created Classes
body:
It would be helpful if the `mixSpecIntoComponent` and its static variant were accessible on the returned descriptor from `createClass()`. That way components need not be defined all at once, giving someone the ability to mixin into someone else's component if they wish. 

In my limited experience this stuff is also really helpful for using React in a larger app framework context. For instance, dependency injection in an ember-esque  way would be really easy, allowing me to inject props/methods, on a type/classes basis in stead of the current (albeit undocumented) global injection functionality in react now.

It also just seems like an unnecessary restriction, not in keeping with the dynamic nature of the language. Why not embrace the prototypal nature of js, and bless redefining/reopening 'Classes'?

my own rudimentary experiments with this has gone well enough, and it fits nicely with the composition-focused abstractions in React. Admittedly, not knowing what the ultimate plan for the `ReactDescriptor` makes it hard to guess at possible conflicts with this approach. One escape hatch might be the additional ability to seal classes?

Is their a strong reason fro not exposing these methods on the descriptor?
